meanings.definition: Lack of definite form or shape.
meanings.sent1: The amorphism of the cloud made it look like a fluffy pillow in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The artist used amorphism to create a unique sculpture that seemed to change shape from every angle.
meanings.sent3: The amorphism of the jello made it wobble like a silly, shape-shifting blob.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a swirling amorphism, constantly changing and never settling.
meanings.sent5: The amorphism of the fog enveloped the entire city, hiding everything from view.

meanings.definition: The state of being formless or shapeless.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious creature in the shadows had an eerie amorphism that made it hard to identify.
meanings.sent2: The amorphism of the ghostly figure seemed to shift and change as it moved through the room.
meanings.sent3: The amorphism of the slime monster made it look like a gooey, ever-changing blob of colors.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the cave seemed to have an amorphism that swallowed all light and sound.
meanings.sent5: The amorphism of the misty forest gave it an otherworldly and dreamlike quality.
